intro: Mesembryanthemum × octophyllum var. roseum, commonly known as the pink ice plant, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves and showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically blooms in spring and summer, producing pink or reddish flowers that attract pollinators. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its ornamental value and drought tolerance contribute to its popularity among gardeners.
